item.title: 英国交易员不再完全相信英国央行会再降息两次
item.description: 在英国通胀率意外飙升之后，交易员们削减了对英国央行今年进一步降息的押注，现在他们认为，到 12 月份，英国央行的降息次数将少于两次。【原文：Traders trimmed bets on further UK interest-rate cuts from the Bank of England this year in the wake of a surprise jump in UK inflation, and now see fewer than two more reductions through December.】

item.title: 欧洲央行即将暂停或停止减息：施纳贝尔致《金融时报
item.description: 欧洲中央银行执行董事会成员伊莎贝尔-施纳贝尔（Isabel Schnabel）告诉《金融时报》，欧洲中央银行不久将不得不讨论暂停或完全结束其降息行动。【原文：The European Central Bank will soon have to discuss taking a break, or ending altogether, its campaign of interest-rate reductions, Executive Board member Isabel Schnabel told the Financial Times.】

item.title: 泰国将在大跌中抑制卖空和高速交易
item.description: 泰国证券交易所将加强对卖空和高频交易的限制，试图重振全球表现最差股票市场的投资者信心。【原文：Thailand’s stock exchange will tighten curbs on short selling and high-frequency trading as it attempts to revive investor confidence in the world’s worst performing equity market.】

item.title: 斯洛伐克在政治动荡中加入地区欧洲债券热潮
item.description: 斯洛伐克政府在政治动荡中寻求控制预算赤字，因此斯洛伐克今年将首次进入国际债务市场，与该地区的其他国家一道。【原文：Slovakia is coming to the international debt markets for the first time this year, joining regional peers as the government seeks to rein in a budget deficit amid political turbulence.】

item.title: 政府停止比利时援助后卢旺达债券进一步下滑
item.description: 卢旺达政府拒绝比利时的进一步援助，并指责布鲁塞尔试图破坏其获得发展资金的渠道，此后卢旺达的美元债券跌至一年多来的最低点。【原文：Rwanda’s dollar bonds slumped to the lowest in more than a year after the government rejected further aid from Belgium and accused Brussels of trying to sabotage its access to development finance.】

item.title: 利率达到两位数，连巴西的亿万富翁也放弃了投资计划
item.description: 当巴西的利率在 12 月达到 12.25% 时，人们很快就发现，即使是亿万富翁也无法让市场为他们服务。【原文：When Brazil’s interest rates hit 12.25% in December, it soon became clear that even billionaires couldn’t make the market work for them.】

item.title: 债券守夜人准备放德国一马
item.description: 在人们对欧洲经济增长乏力感到担忧之际，投资者在德国大选前向德国发出了一个明确的信息：德国有更多的借贷空间。【原文：As fears swirl over Europe’s anemic growth, investors are sending Germany a clear message ahead of its election that there’s room to borrow more.】

item.title: 2024 年伦敦房价未能增长
item.description: 2024 年，由于首都住宅房地产市场停滞不前，伦敦房价在考虑通货膨胀因素后出现下跌。【原文：London house prices dropped when accounting for inflation in 2024, as the capital’s residential property market ground to a halt.】

item.title: 巴克莱策略师称，欧洲股市的轻松上涨已经结束
item.description: 巴克莱银行（Barclays Plc）策略师表示，欧洲股市的 "轻松收益 "已经结束，经过今年的大幅反弹后，目前市场价格已经相当合理。【原文：The “easy gains” are over for European stocks, with the market now fairly priced after this year’s sharp rally, according to Barclays Plc strategists.】

item.title: 分析师认为 "和平贸易 "抑制了天然气股的涨势
item.description: 由于白宫寻求迅速解决乌克兰战争，北美天然气出口商的股票正在削减三年来的涨幅。分析人士称，如果解除对俄罗斯天然气的制裁，这些公司可能会遭受更大的损失，从而在其关键市场上增加新的竞争。【原文：Stocks of North American natural gas exporters are trimming a three-year rally as the White House seeks a swift resolution to the war in Ukraine. Analysts say those companies could suffer even more if sanctions on Russian gas are lifted, adding new competition in their key markets.】

item.title: 中国对外投资创三年来最弱开局
item.description: 中国的对外投资创下了三年来最弱的开局，1 月份外国企业在中国的新支出仅略高于 130 亿美元。【原文：China recorded the weakest start for inbound investment in three years, with just over $13 billion in new spending by foreign firms in the country in January.】

item.title: 中国判处前中国工商银行银行家张某死刑，缓期执行
item.description: 中国以受贿罪判处中国工商银行股份有限公司前银行家张红力死刑，缓期执行。【原文：China sentenced Zhang Hongli, a former banker at Industrial & Commercial Bank of China Ltd., to death with a reprieve for taking bribes, as authorities maintained their tight grip on the $67 trillion financial sector.】

item.title: 南非民主党领袖将在预算演讲后向媒体介绍情况
item.description: 南非联合政府第二大党民主联盟（Democratic Alliance）领导人将向媒体介绍该党对预算进程的立场，因为有报道称财政部即将提高税收。【原文：The leader of the Democratic Alliance, the second-largest party in South Africa’s coalition government, will brief the media about its stance on the budget process amid reports the Treasury is about to raise taxes.】

item.title: 嘉士伯、强生利用欧洲市场发行 M&A 债券
item.description: 随着嘉士伯啤酒公司（Carlsberg Breweries A/S）和强生公司（Johnson & Johnson）注入今年第一笔大额收购债务，欧洲一级市场周三将得到提振。【原文：Europe’s primary market is set to get a boost on Wednesday as Carlsberg Breweries A/S and Johnson & Johnson inject the first major buyout debt of the year.】

item.title: 英国地方议会以成本过高为由取消债券计划
item.description: 英国兰开夏郡取消了再次出售债券的计划，这对该国奄奄一息的市政债务市场是一个打击。【原文：The UK county of Lancashire has scrapped plans to sell another bond in a blow to the country’s moribund market for municipal debt.】

item.title: 电池制造商将在马来西亚经济区投资 1.5 亿美元
item.description: 电池制造商金山科技集团（Gold Peak Technology Group）将投资 1.5 亿美元，在马来西亚南部的一个经济特区建立一家新工厂。【原文：Battery-maker Gold Peak Technology Group will invest $150 million and establish a new plant in a special economic zone in southern Malaysia.】

item.title: 意大利总统帕内塔称过度监管是欧盟银行面临的风险
item.description: 意大利央行行长法比奥-帕内塔（Fabio Panetta）表示，如果监管机构不调查该行业是否因规则而负担过重，欧洲贷款机构可能会输给国际竞争对手。【原文：European lenders could lose out to international competitors if regulators don’t look into whether the industry is overly burdened by rules, according to Italian central-bank Governor Fabio Panetta.】

item.title: 中国科技公司借 DeepSeek 反弹之势筹集更多资金
item.description: 中国科技公司利用 DeepSeek 推动的 1 万亿美元涨势，以及中国政府对这一曾经饱受打击的行业采取的较为缓和的立场，推动股票融资，可谓众望所归。【原文：The stars are aligned for Chinese technology companies to boost stock financing, capitalizing on a DeepSeek-driven $1 trillion rally and Beijing’s softer stance on the once-battered sector.】

item.title: 迪拜推动太阳能电池项目，为价值 60 亿美元的阿联酋计划锦上添花
item.description: 就在阿布扎比宣布一项价值 60 亿美元的类似项目一个月后，迪拜计划建造一座太阳能发电厂，并配备电池储能装置，以实现不间断供电，从而实现阿拉伯联合酋长国雄心勃勃的清洁能源目标。【原文：Dubai plans to build a solar plant with battery storage for uninterrupted power supply, just a month after Abu Dhabi unveiled a similar $6 billion project, as the United Arab Emirates pursues ambitious clean energy goals.】

item.title: 俄罗斯最繁忙港口的石油出口不受制裁限制
item.description: 俄罗斯太平洋主要码头的原油出口保持强劲，因为托运人和贸易商又一次绕过了美国的新一轮限制，使用了新的船只来保持桶装原油的运输。【原文：Crude-oil exports from Russia’s main Pacific terminal remain robust as shippers and traders — yet again — work around a fresh batch of curbs from the US, enlisting a new roster of vessels to keep barrels moving.】

item.title: 印尼内阁首次改组，普拉博沃撤换助手
item.description: 印度尼西亚总统普拉博沃-苏比安托在去年上任后的首次内阁改组中任命布莱恩-尤利亚托（Brian Yuliarto）为新的高等教育、科学和技术部长。【原文：Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto named Brian Yuliarto as the new higher education, science and technology minister in his first cabinet reshuffle after taking office last year.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长帕内塔称经济疲软比预期严重
item.description: 欧洲中央银行管理委员会成员法比奥-帕内塔说，欧元区经济低迷的持续时间比预期的要长，他警告说，迄今为止弹性十足的就业市场可能正在出现裂痕。【原文：The euro zone’s bout of economic sluggishness is lasting longer than anticipated, European Central Bank Governing Council member Fabio Panetta said, warning that the so far resilient jobs market may be cracking.】

item.title: 乌克兰无人机瞄准伏尔加河地区俄罗斯石油公司 Syzran 炼油厂
item.description: 据当地州长 Vyacheslav Fedorishchev 称，乌克兰无人机一夜之间袭击了俄罗斯伏尔加河地区的 Syzran 炼油厂。【原文：Ukrainian drones struck the Syzran refinery in Russia’s Volga region overnight, according to the local governor Vyacheslav Fedorishchev.】

item.title: 分析师称印尼暂停加息为印尼盾提供支持
item.description: 分析师说，印尼央行维持利率不变后，印尼盾可能会得到一些缓解，但由于担心经济增长放缓，当地股市可能会重拾跌势。【原文：The Indonesian rupiah may get some relief after the central bank kept its interest rate unchanged, though local stocks are likely to resume their decline amid concerns over slowing economic growth, analysts said.】

item.title: 华尔街对特朗普回归的兴奋程度不断变化
item.description:
在本期特朗普经济学节目中，我们将讨论银行家对新政府的担忧。【原文：

In this episode of Trumponomics, we discuss the concerns bankers are beginning to have with the new administration.

】

item.title: 花旗、瑞银为贝恩收购 Apleona 筹借 20 亿欧元债务
item.description: 花旗集团（Citigroup Inc）和瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）正在组织约 20 亿欧元（21 亿美元）的资金，以支持贝恩资本（Bain Capital）收购德国设施管理公司 Apleona Group GmbH —；这是近年来并购案稀少的情况下达成的一项罕见交易。【原文：Citigroup Inc. and UBS Group AG are organizing about €2 billion ($2.1 billion) of funding to back Bain Capital’s acquisition of German facility-management company Apleona Group GmbH — a rare deal amid a dearth of acquisitions in recent years.】

item.title: 开普敦风灾导致 Transnet 在旺季长期受阻
item.description: 南非 Transnet SOC 有限公司正在采取措施，克服开普敦集装箱码头在水果出口旺季期间受到的强风影响。【原文：South Africa’s Transnet SOC Ltd. is taking measures to overcome strong winds at the Cape Town Container Terminal that have dented its performance during a peak season for fruit exports.】

item.title: Monde Nissin 可能注销肉类替代品部门的 1.26 亿美元资产
item.description: 菲律宾最大的方便面生产商 Monde Nissin Corp. 因肉类替代品业务陷入困境，可能在 2024 年计提高达 1.26 亿美元的减值费用。【原文：Monde Nissin Corp., the Philippines’ largest instant noodle maker, may take an impairment charge of as much as $126 million for 2024 as it struggles with its meat-alternative business.】

item.title: 奥拉诺称铀价反弹或将重振采矿项目
item.description: Orano SA 首席执行官尼古拉斯-梅斯（Nicolas Maes）表示，由于放射性金属价格反弹以及核燃料服务提高了 2024 年的收益，Orano SA 正在考虑恢复在纳米比亚开采铀矿的项目。【原文：Orano SA is considering reviving a project to mine uranium in Namibia as rebounding prices for the radioactive metal as well as nuclear-fuel services have boosted 2024 earnings, Chief Executive Officer Nicolas Maes said.】

item.title: 汇丰旗下恒生银行香港物业减值激增
item.description: 汇丰控股公司控制的香港贷款机构恒生银行有限公司录得的商业房地产信贷减值激增，因为香港的经济困境开始波及本地贷款机构。【原文：Hang Seng Bank Ltd., a Hong Kong lender controlled by HSBC Holdings Plc, recorded a surge in credit impairment on commercial real estate as the city’s economic struggles are starting to spill over on local lenders.】
